intro: Onychium subulatum, commonly known as the needleleaf onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
